dcterms:description: The VesSAP dataset consists of light-sheet microscopy images of mouse brains. The labels provide a segmentation of the vessel structure, which has a complicated topological structure with many connected components and cycles.
dcterms:title: VesSAP

dcterms:creator: David Svoboda
Ondřej Homola
Stanislav Stejskal
dcterms:description: The BBBC027 dataset consists of synthetic colon cell microscopy images, which exhibit a large number of small connected components that are often in close proximity and separated by thin gaps.
dcterms:title: BBBC027

dcterms:creator: Jan Funke
Fabian Tschopp
William Grisaitis
Arlo Sheridan
Chandan Singh
Stephan Saalfeld
Srinivas C. Turaga
dcterms:description: The CREMI dataset contains brain tissue scans of Drosophila melanogaster, with segmented instances of neurons. The dataset is characterized by a topologically complex label map with many cycles and cavities.
dcterms:title: CREMI (boundaries)

dcterms:description: The synthetic spheres dataset consists of hollow spheres with a constant surface thickness, regularly arranged in a grid. Each pair of adjacent spheres is connected by a thin bridge, making the segmentation challenging.
dcterms:title: Synthetic Spheres

dcterms:description: The synthetic spheres with holes dataset is a variation of the synthetic spheres dataset, where spheres have random thickness and may have holes, creating additional topological challenges for segmentation.
dcterms:title: Synthetic Spheres with Holes
